info.title: PhoneNumbersClient
info.description: The phone numbers client uses Azure Communication Services to purchase and manage phone numbers and short codes.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers
post.summary: Search for available phone numbers to purchase.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The ISO 3166-2 country code, e.g. US.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' and 'Location' headers. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header. When operation completes successfully query final result using URL specified in 'Location' header.

Location.description: URL to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers
get.summary: Gets a phone number search result by search id.

tags: Find and purchase available phone numbers

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' header. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

get.summary: Gets an operation by its id.

200.description: When the operation is completed, query the final result of the operation using the URL specified in the 'Location' attribute in the response header.

Location.description: Url to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

delete.summary: Cancels an operation by its id.

patch.summary: Updates the capabilities of a phone number.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The phone number id in E.164 format. The leading plus can be either + or encoded as %2B, e.g. +11234567890.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' and 'Location' headers. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header. When operation completes successfully query final result using URL specified in 'Location' header.

Location.description: URL to retrieve the final result after operation completes.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

get.summary: Gets the details of the given purchased phone number.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: The purchased phone number whose details are to be fetched in E.164 format, e.g. +11234567890.

parameters.name: phoneNumber
parameters.description: Phone number to be released, e.g. +11234567890.

202.description: The service has accepted the request and will start processing later. It will return 'Accepted' immediately and include an 'Operation-Location' header. Client side should further query the operation status using the URL specified in 'Operation-Location' header.

Operation-Location.description: URL to query for status of the operation.

get.summary: Gets the list of all purchased phone numbers.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes. The default value is 0.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes. The default value is 100.

get.summary: Gets the list of short codes for the current resource.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes.

patch.summary: Creates or updates a US Program Brief.

parameters.name: programBriefId
parameters.description: Program Brief Id. Must be a valid GUID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data to create new a Program Brief or fields to update an existing Program Brief

parameters.name: programBriefId
parameters.description: Program Brief Id. Must be a valid GUID

get.summary: Gets the list of US Program Briefs for the current resource.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to skip, for pagination purposes.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: An optional parameter for how many entries to return, for pagination purposes.

PhoneNumberSearchRequest.description: Represents a phone number search request to find phone numbers. Found phone numbers are temporarily held for a following purchase.

phoneNumberType.description: The type of phone numbers to search for, e.g. geographic, or tollFree.

assignmentType.description: The assignment type of the phone numbers to search for. A phone number can be assigned to a person, or to an application.

areaCode.description: The area code of the desired phone number, e.g. 425.

quantity.description: The quantity of desired phone numbers. The default value is 1.

PhoneNumberCost.description: The incurred cost for a single phone number.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the cost amount, e.g. USD.

billingFrequency.description: The frequency with which the cost gets billed.

PhoneNumberSearchResult.description: The result of a phone number search operation.

phoneNumbers.description: The phone numbers that are available. Can be fewer than the desired search quantity.

phoneNumberType.description: The phone number's type, e.g. geographic, or tollFree.

searchExpiresBy.description: The date that this search result expires and phone numbers are no longer on hold. A search result expires in less than 15min, e.g. 2020-11-19T16:31:49.048Z.

PhoneNumberPurchaseRequest.description: The phone number search purchase request.

operationType.description: The type of operation, e.g. Search

resourceLocation.description: URL for retrieving the result of the operation, if any.

createdDateTime.description: The date that the operation was created.

lastActionDateTime.description: The most recent date that the operation was changed.

id.description: The id of the phone number, e.g. 11234567890.

phoneNumber.description: String of the E.164 format of the phone number, e.g. +11234567890.

countryCode.description: The ISO 3166-2 code of the phone number's country, e.g. US.

phoneNumberType.description: The phone number's type, e.g. geographic, tollFree.

assignmentType.description: The assignment type of the phone number. A phone number can be assigned to a person, or to an application.

purchaseDate.description: The date and time that the phone number was purchased.

PurchasedPhoneNumbers.description: The list of purchased phone numbers.

phoneNumbers.description: Represents a list of phone numbers.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page of phone number results.

ShortCodeEntity.description: Represents a number, ShortCode or AlphaId, acquired in a given country.

number.description: The value of the ShortCode or the alpha numeric e.g. '555555', 'CONTOSO', etc.

countryCode.description: ISO 3166 2-char code representing the country e.g. 'US'.

purchaseDate.description: Date in which number was purchased.

ShortCodeEntities.description: A wrapper for a list of short code entities.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page

ShortCodeCost.description: The incurred cost for a single short code.

currencyCode.description: The ISO 4217 currency code for the cost amount, e.g. USD.

billingFrequency.description: The frequency with which the cost gets billed.

isVanity.description: Set to true if the request is for a vanity number.

preferredVanityNumbers.description:
Priority ordered list of preferred vanity numbers.
Vanity numbers should be 5 or 6 digit when number type is ShortCode.
e.g. 555555, 222222.

numberType.description: Type for desired numbers e.g. 'shortCode' or 'alphaId'.

isPoliticalCampaign.description: Indicates whether the number will be used for political campaigns or not.

name.description:
A program name that indicates the purpose of filling the Program Brief and how the number will be used for messaging.
e.g. 'CONTOSO Shipping'

description.description: Describes how and why the number will be used for messaging as part of the program.

url.description: URL for the program or company.

signUpTypes.description: Indicates how the consumer can sign up to the program e.g. 'website', 'pointOfSale' and/or 'sms'.

items.description: Indicates how a program will be discoverable by the consumer.

signUp.description:
Call to action description for the program.
e.g. 'This program will allow for consumers to receive a one-time passcode to validate their
authenticity when making a purchase online.  Through a verification process, they will have an
option to validate using a passcode sent via SMS, amongst the options. If they choose to have
the passcode sent over SMS they will receive this one-time message.  If they chose to opt out,
they may select \"STOP\" rather than continuing.'.

termsOfServiceUrl.description: URL for program terms of service.

expectedDateOfService.description:
Date in which SMS messages will start to be sent out.
Should follow ISO 8601 internet format for datetimes.
e.g. 2021-08-17T22:02:51.316Z, 2021-08-17T16:39:57-08:00, etc.

name.description: Legal entity name for customer submitting Program Brief.

url.description: Company URL for customer submitting Program Brief.

address.description: Company's address for the customer submitting the Program Brief.

contactName.description: Name of authorized user for purposes of submitting the Program Brief.

contactPhone.description: Contact phone number for the authorized user for the customer. Use E164 format. e.g. +14086111111.

contactEmail.description: Contact email address number for the authorized user for the customer.

customerCareTollFreeNumber.description: Customer support phone number for the customer submitting the Program Brief. Use E164 format. e.g. +18005551212

customerCareEmail.description: Customer support email address for the customer submitting the Program Brief.

types.description: Applicable message types used in the program e.g. SMS, MMS.

items.description: Applicable message types to be used in a program.

recurrence.description: Indicates the nature of the messaging associated with the program e.g. 'subscription', 'transaction'.

contentTypes.description: Indicates the messaging content types used in the program e.g. 'ringTones', 'smsChat', 'video', 'loyaltyProgramPointsPrizes', 'gifting', 'inApplicationBilling', 'textToScreen', etc.

items.description: Indicates the messaging content type used in the program.

helpMessage.description:
Message text for mobile terminated message associated with HELP keyword
e.g 'This is the HELP message test.'.

optOutMessage.description:
"Message text for mobile terminated message associated with STOP keyword
e.g. 'This is the STOP message test.'.

optInReply.description: Keyword used to confirm double Opt-In method e.g. 'JOIN'.

monthlyAverageMessagesFromUser.description: Estimated number of Mobile-Originated messages likely to be received from a user per month.

monthlyAverageMessagesToUser.description: Estimated number of Mobile-Terminated messages likely to be sent per user per month.

isSpiky.description: Indicates if the nature of the messaging traffic will be bursty.

spikeDetails.description:
If isSpiky=true, then explain additional details about the traffic pattern
e.g. 'Higher traffic expected during holiday season and Black Friday.'.

ProgramBriefEntity.description:
A Program Brief provides vital information to the carriers about a messaging program or campaign that would be associated with a short code or alpha sender number in a given country.
A Program Brief also provides specifics about the use case, the purpose and the consumer experience receiving the message.

number.description: Number provisioned for the Program Brief e.g. 555555, 'CONTOSO'

comment.description:
Comments added to the Program Brief after being reviewed to help customer understand
review results and necessary follow up actions.

lastUpdateDate.description: Last date and time when the Program Brief was updated.

creationDate.description: Date and time when the Program Brief was created.

ProgramBriefEntities.description: A wrapper for a list of ProgramBrief entities.

nextLink.description: Represents the URL link to the next page
